docs.snippet: For this issue, the embodiment of what calm remains in the chaos of this administration.
If there is a Trump-Kim meeting, it will join a pantheon that includes Kennedy-Khruschev, Nixon-Mao, Bush-Putin and Obama-Castro. Some have been productive, some not.

headline.print_headline: Summits of Adversaries: They Haven’t Always Worked Out So Well
headline.main: Summits of Adversaries: They Haven’t Always Worked Out So Well

docs.snippet: A reader worries about the “catastrophic results that can flow from foreign influence in the White House.”
Education Secretary Betsy DeVos will defend her agency’s budget before a House panel, including a reorganization plan that staff members say she tried to withhold from Congress.

headline.main: As DeVos Faces Congress, Officials Say She Hid Plans to Overhaul Department

docs.snippet: The administration is vetting Dr. Robert Redfield, a founder of the University of Maryland’s Institute of Human Virology, for C.D.C. chief.

headline.print_headline: AIDS Researcher at University of Maryland Is Being Vetted to Be Next Leader of C.D.C.
headline.main: AIDS Researcher Top Candidate to Lead the C.D.C.

docs.snippet: The pornographic film actress, who says she had an affair with President Trump, offered on Monday to return $130,000 she received from Mr. Trump’s personal lawyer in order to break her silence about what occurred.

headline.main: Stormy Daniels’ Offer to Reclaim Her Right to Speak

docs.snippet: Five days after details about Cambridge Analytica’s data mining were made public, Mark Zuckerberg, Facebook’s chief executive, spoke with The New York Times.

headline.main: Listen to ‘The Daily’: Can Facebook Be Fixed?

docs.snippet: The $1.5 trillion tax cut spawned a host of errors and ambiguities in the law that businesses big and small are just now discovering and scrambling to address.

headline.print_headline: Tax Law’s Errors  Upset Employers  As Leaders Feud
headline.main: G.O.P. Rushed to Pass Tax Overhaul. Now It May Need to Be Altered.

docs.snippet: A reader is skeptical of Mr. Cohn’s explanation of why he is leaving the Trump administration.
Gary D. Cohn, President Trump’s top economic adviser, plans to resign. He opposed the president’s plan to impose tariffs on steel and aluminum imports.

headline.main: Another White House Exit: Gary Cohn
